title: Trump's strikes on boats killed 21. A Senate push to stop them failed.
shortDescription: A Senate measure to stop President Donald Trump's strikes on boats he has claimed, without evidence, are carrying drugs failed to pass its first vote.

title: She was elected to Congress Sept. 23. She still can't take her seat.
shortDescription: Adelita Grijalva won an Arizona special election. She'd be the key to forcing a vote on releasing the Epstein files. But she can't get sworn in.

title: Trump jabs Schumer, predicts he'll retire
shortDescription: President Donald Trump took swipes at top Democrats during a Cabinet meeting, saying "we really don't know who the hell is leading" them.

title: 'We're calling it Columbus Day': Trump signs proclamation honoring explorer
shortDescription: The Trump administration has taken a keen interest in how U.S. history is presented, targeting alleged "woke" policies and institutions.

title: 'My kids could die': Military wife confronts Mike Johnson over shutdown
shortDescription: "My kids could die," a military wife from Virginia frustratedly told the speaker of the House.

title: President Trump eyes Nobel Peace Prize
shortDescription: Trump repeated the claim he stopped seven wars when asked by USA TODAY White House correspondent Swapna Venugopal Ramaswamy about Nobel Peace Prize.

title: With a Mideast accord, Trump has legacy on his mind - Nobel or not
shortDescription: The president touts 'a deal for 3,000 years' between Israel and Hamas. The focus on history's judgment? Call it Second-Term Syndrome.

title: Trump's troop deployments in Chicago, Portland to be argued in court
shortDescription: President Trump's National Guard deployments in Oregon and Illinois will be tested in court hearings scheduled for Thursday, Oct. 9.

title: Trump speaks to hostage families on phone
shortDescription: President Donald Trump spoke with families of Israeli hostages, telling them their loved ones will return in a few days.

title: Who is Sen. Blumenthal? Trump says he shouldn't 'be allowed to speak.'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump went after Senator Richard Blumenthal saying he should be investigated and not be in the Senate. He is in his third term.

title: Trump hankers for Nobel peace prize. Should he get it?
shortDescription: Five former Norwegian lawmakers will award the Nobel Peace Prize on Oct. 10. A certain American president wants it. Very much.

title: 'We took the freedom of speech away:' Trump says on flag burning
shortDescription: President Trump reiterated his position that flag burning isn't protected speech at a roundtable, despite a Supreme Court case protecting the right.

title: Trump announces Israel-Hamas peace deal
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announced that Israel and Hamas have signed off on the first phase of a peace plan.

title: Trump says Israeli hostages in Gaza will be released 'very soon'
shortDescription: The first phase of the deal called for the release of Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinians jailed in Israel.

title: Democrats and Republicans still haven't found a compromise
shortDescription: Eight days into the government shutdown and Democrats and Republicans appear to be no closer to reaching a deal.

title: President Trump to undergo medical exam at Walter Reed on Friday
shortDescription: President Trump is set to undergo a medical checkup at Walter Reed on Friday after recently being diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency.

title: Poll: Trump's National Guard deployments unpopular with Americans
shortDescription: With National Guard troops poised to enter Chicago, a new poll shows an uneasiness among Americans about Trump's expanding military deployments.

title: A handful of Democrats could end the shutdown. No one's budging (yet).
shortDescription: If there's a way out of the government shutdown, it has everything to do with Democrats in the United States Senate.
